Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that the applicant had a safe internal flight alternative (IFA) in Fiji
Application_Facts: Mr. Kumar's issues were localized to his village; relocation within Fiji was deemed reasonable despite economic challenges and land tenure issues
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Immigration and Refugee Board's decision
Court_Ruling: No patent unreasonableness in the Board's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Threats based on race and political opinion in Fiji
Legal_Standard: Two-pronged test for IFA: (1) no serious possibility of persecution, and (2) conditions must not be unreasonably harsh
Assessment_Factor: Localization of harm, economic challenges, land tenure issues
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of Immigration and Refugee Board decision
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to race and political opinion
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; no question certified
Harm_Assessment: Localized threats in village, not generalized risk
Cause_Description: Mr. Kumar claimed refugee status due to threats based on race and political opinion in Fiji
Decision_Rationale: No serious possibility of persecution upon internal relocation; conditions not unreasonably harsh
Legal_Standard_Applied: Two-pronged test for safe internal flight alternative
